evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

The airport operator and ATC were notified. Soon after, representatives from the airport operator and the RFFS were on scene. The aircraft sustained substantial damage to the rear of the aircraft, including the APU, which was running at the time.
The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.

The tug instructor stated that the method for getting a tug driver to stop quickly was to raise a clenched first, indicating the driver should apply the tug’s brakes. However, he suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view. He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

Trainee tug driver The trainee driver was qualified as a headset operator and wingman, and was aware of the TRP through the training for these roles. This was her second pushback. The first was completed earlier that day, without event.

The trainee driver reported that she felt the tug slow down as the aircraft’s nose wheel approached the TRP, so believed the instructor would stop the pushback. However, she did not say anything when he drove past the TRP, assuming he must have known what he was doing. After the collision, she suggested not moving the aircraft off the blast fence.
Headset operator The headset operator was also qualified as a wingman. Prior to this accident, he knew about TRPs from his training for the headset operator role but had not physically seen one.

He commented that the tug instructor took over when the aircraft was abeam Stand 62 and thereafter was attending to talking to the trainee. The tug slowed down when the aircraft was abeam Stand 61, so he positioned himself to disconnect the tug from the aircraft when it stopped. However, the aircraft continued to move slowly until it hit the blast fence. He said he assumed the instructor had a reason for that and did not question his actions.

Wingman The wingman was also a qualified headset operator. On the day of the accident, he had been called into work at short notice. To avoid delaying the pushback, he had not collected the marshalling wands from the tug. Nevertheless, it was not mandatory to use them. He commented that the TRP was quite small.

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and consistently observed during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25 in the hist_t3_prefinal phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew remains a valid root cause despite potential alternative explanations, as the evidence from the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_t3_prefinal phase strongly supports this conclusion.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features such as missed callouts, delayed responses, and unclear information exchange observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_t3_prefinal data.

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t3_prefinal inspection on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of the environmental or marking deficiency must be robust against potential defeaters or exceptions in the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_t3_prefinal inspection.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency should correspond to the key features and criteria defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t3_prefinal inspection.

slot_statements.availability: Mechanical/control failure was present and observable in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: Mechanical/control failure withstands potential defeaters within the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t3_prefinal context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: Mechanical/control failure aligns with the key features identified in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t3_prefinal scope.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and observable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the 12-25 hist_t3 prefinal phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands scrutiny against potential counterarguments or alternative explanations within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_t3 prefinal context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_t3 prefinal, including timing, crew actions, and communication protocols.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and consistently observed during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25 in the hist_t3_prefinal phase.

defeaters: If evidence showed active, clear, and effective communication and coordination preventing the incident
If crew members had explicitly warned or corrected each other during the event

quotes.exact_quote: He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.
She did not say anything when he drove past the TRP, assuming he must have known what he was doing.
He said he assumed the instructor had a reason for that and did not question his actions.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly indicates a lack of effective communication and coordination among crew members during the pushback, as no warnings were given despite the aircraft passing the TRP and continuing to the blast fence (H8, H10, H12).
outcome.uncertainty_source: absence of detailed communication logs or recordings; reliance on post-event statements

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure was present and observable in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.

defeaters: Evidence of any mechanical or control system malfunction or failure in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the incident.
outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided history evidence (H1-H13) indicates any mechanical or control failure; all describe human actions and situational details during the pushback and collision event.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t3_prefinal inspection on 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed that the TRP markings were missing, unclear, or otherwise deficient during the inspection, or if personnel reported such deficiencies.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history indicates the presence or identification of an environmental or marking deficiency on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t3_prefinal inspection on 12-25.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and observable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the 12-25 hist_t3 prefinal phase.

defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback was executed strictly according to procedure without deviation or if the aircraft did not pass the TRP or hit the blast barrier.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.

The tug instructor stated that the method for getting a tug driver to stop quickly was to raise a clenched first, indicating the driver should apply the tug’s brakes. However, he suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view. He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

The trainee driver reported that she felt the tug slow down as the aircraft’s nose wheel approached the TRP, so believed the instructor would stop the pushback. However, she did not say anything when he drove past the TRP, assuming he must have known what he was doing.

He commented that the tug instructor took over when the aircraft was abeam Stand 62 and thereafter was attending to talking to the trainee. The tug slowed down when the aircraft was abeam Stand 61, so he positioned himself to disconnect the tug from the aircraft when it stopped. However, the aircraft continued to move slowly until it hit the blast fence. He said he assumed the instructor had a reason for that and did not question his actions.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly documents and describes the procedural deviation during pushback execution with the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the specified phase, including the aircraft passing the TRP and hitting the blast barrier (H4, H7), and multiple eyewitness accounts confirming the event and procedural context (H8, H10, H12).
outcome.uncertainty_source: None significant; the event and deviation are well documented in the history.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features such as missed callouts, delayed responses, and unclear information exchange observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_t3_prefinal data.

assumptions: Assuming that the absence of warnings and callouts indicates communication breakdown
Assuming that the described behaviors reflect typical crew communication patterns during the event
defeaters: If evidence showed explicit, timely communication and warnings preventing the incident
If the crew had clear, unambiguous information exchange documented

quotes.exact_quote: He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.
She did not say anything when he drove past the TRP, assuming he must have known what he was doing.
He said he assumed the instructor had a reason for that and did not question his actions.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly shows missed callouts (H10), delayed or absent warnings (H8), and unclear information exchange or assumptions (H12), aligning with key features of communication/coordination breakdown.
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of detailed transcripts or recordings of communications; reliance on post-event statements

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency should correspond to the key features and criteria defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t3_prefinal inspection.

defeaters: Direct documentation or inspection report confirming the environmental or marking deficiency matches the key features and criteria for the specific aircraft in the hist_t3_prefinal inspection.

quotes.exact_quote: The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.
He commented that the TRP was quite small.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes the TRP location and clearance for the Boeing 737-800 but does not explicitly confirm that the environmental or marking deficiency corresponds to the key features and criteria defined for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t3_prefinal inspection (H7, H13).
